description: From mid 17th century, equivalent to re- +‎ mind (“to remember”). Probably suggested by obsolete rememorate with the same sense. Displaced Old English myndgian.

verbs.description: remind (third-person singular simple present reminds, present participle reminding, simple past and past participle reminded)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To cause one to experience a memory (of someone or something); to bring to the notice or consideration (of a person).
examples: Synonym: put someone in mind of
